Package imagingbook.pub.regions.segment

Class BinaryRegionSegmentation

  • java.lang.Object
    • imagingbook.pub.regions.segment.BinaryRegionSegmentation
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BreadthFirstSegmentation, DepthFirstSegmentation, RecursiveSegmentation, RegionContourSegmentation, SegmentationBreadthFirst, SegmentationDepthFirst, SegmentationRecursive, SegmentationRegionContour, SegmentationSequential, SequentialSegmentation
    public abstract class BinaryRegionSegmentation
extends java.lang.Object
    Performs region segmentation on a given binary image. This class is abstract, since the implementation depends on the concrete region segmentation algorithm being used. Concrete implementations (subclasses of this class) are BreadthFirstSegmentation, DepthFirstSegmentation, RecursiveSegmentation, SequentialSegmentation, RegionContourSegmentation. Practically all work is done by the constructor(s). If the segmentation has failed for some reason getRegions() returns null.
    Version:
    2021/12/22

      • getRegions

        public java.util.List<BinaryRegion> getRegions()
        Returns an unsorted list of all regions associated with this region labeling. The returned list is empty if no regions were detected. See also getRegions(boolean).
        Returns:
        the list of detected regions or null if the segmentation has failed.

      • getRegions

        public java.util.List<BinaryRegion> getRegions​(boolean sort)
        Returns a (optionally sorted) list of all regions associated with this region labeling. The returned list is empty if no regions were detected.
        Parameters:
        sort - set true to sort regions by size (largest regions first).
        Returns:
        the list of detected regions or null if the segmentation has failed.

      • collectRegions

        protected java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,​SegmentationBackedRegion> collectRegions()
        Creates a (map) container of BinaryRegion objects, collects the region pixels from the label image and calls SegmentationBackedRegion.update() to compute the statistics for each region. Region label numbers serve as map keys.
        Returns:
        a map of BinaryRegion instances.

      • getLabel

        public int getLabel​(int u,
                    int v)
        Get the label number for the specified image coordinate.
        Parameters:

        v - the vertical coordinate.
        Returns:
        the label number for the given position.

        public SegmentationBackedRegion getRegion​(int label)
        Finds the region associated to the given label.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • getRegion

        public SegmentationBackedRegion getRegion​(int u,
                                          int v)
        Finds the BinaryRegion instance associated with the given image position.
        Parameters:
        u - the horizontal position.
        v - the vertical position.
        Returns:
        The associated BinaryRegion object or null if this BinaryRegionSegmentation has no region at the given position.
